item.title: Third World Linux - Episode 119: Lubuntu + Whisker Menu, Peerflix, Planning AG's Backup System
item.description:
In the podcast this week...

Joao gushes over Lubuntu, AG thinks RAID is a backup, and a bit of talk about piracy.

---

Joao's Thing He Did

 (I'll do a standalone post for these with screenshots and whatnot, but here's the outline)


 The Lubuntu Mod
Install the whisker menu and indicator plugin (it pulls down the XFCE panel as a dependency):

                sudo apt-get update

                sudo apt-get install xfce4-whiskermenu-plugin xfce4-indicator-plugin

                

                

                The config file to mess with LXDE is in /home/yourUser/.config/lxsession/Lubuntu/desktop.conf

                

                

                

                Find the line that says...
                
                

                

                

                
panel/command=lxpanel

                

                

                

                and change it to

                

                

                
panel/command=xfce4-panel

                

                

                

                Restart and you should have the XFCE menu installed and you can configure from there.

                

                

                

                For Numix and Arc, add the Numix repository, download the Numix icon set and Numix theme, and download the arc theme.

                

                
sudo apt-add-repository ppa:numix/ppa

                
sudo apt-get update

                
sudo apt-get install arc-theme numix-blue-gtk-theme numix-icon-theme-circle

                

                

                

                ---

                

                Download the episode here. 

                

                Support us on Patreon (pretty please).

                

                ---

                

                

                Listen and Subscribe... 

                

                

                

                
                
                
                
                
                
                

                

                

                
                
                
                
                

                

                we're @thirdworldlinux and @chFourteen on twitter

                we're also on Google+

                but if you're oldschool, email us

                contact@channelfourteen.com 

                linux@channelfourteen.com 

                

                

                

                ---

item.title: Third World Linux - Episode 118: Ubuntu Tutorials Launch, minidlna, The Third Person Singular/Plural
item.description:
In the podcast this week...

Back to business as usual.

---

Link Dump:

Ubuntu Tutorials
The Linux Command Line by William Shotts
minidlna

---

Joao's Thing He Did: minidlna

 (I still have to mess around with the formatting of this section)

Install minidlna:

sudo apt-get update
                sudo apt-get install minidlna

The config is in /etc/minidlna.conf

Find the line that says... 

media_dir=/var/lib/minidlna

... and change it to the directory you want to put your media files in.

Finally, restart minidlna

sudo service restart minidlna

---

Download the episode here.

And in the off-tangent, we talk about presidential candidates.

Is Comelec liable for website data leak?
Comelec to sue hackers 'in next few days'
Whoopdeedoo Comics on Facebook

item.title: Third World Linux - Episode 81: A List of Distro List Categories
item.description:
In the podcast this week...

We make a list of some distro categories we'd like to see.


The List So Far...

AG's 2 Gigabyte Club (the bigger the better).
Distros That Would Look Good Next to an Olivia Munn Poster.
Sciencey Distros.
The Desktop Environment Hipster Distros.
Distros for Preaching the Gospel of Linux (reliable distros that just work).
Distros for Preaching the Gospel of Linux (fucking cool).
Joke Distros.
Distros Too Niche to Function.
Distros You Can Bring Home to Your Parents (old people proof).
Distros You Can Bring Home to Your Parents (sweet, simple, a bit quirky but not crazy).
The Workhorses.
Distress With Funky Names.
Distress That Purport to be for Beginners but Aren't Really.
God Mode Distros.
Distros That Third World Linux Knows Exist but Consistently Forgets to Mention Them.


Download the episode here. 


Listen and Subscribe... 



we're @thirdworldlinux and @chFourteen on twitter
we're also on Google+
but if you're oldschool, email us
contact@channelfourteen.com 
linux@channelfourteen.com

item.description:
In the podcast this week...

We tell you to go to the Ubuntu Podcast's list of mostly Linux related podcasts.

In the off tangent (starts at 7:10), we talk about the non-linux Podcasts we listen to.

In the other off tangent (starts at 37:30), we talk a bit about VR.


 Joao's Non-Linux Podcast List

 Cruel and Unusual: A Podcast on Punishment
Nuke the Stars 
Comic Vine
Comic Geek Speak
Pop Culture by Phantasmic Geek
Fatman on Batman
Radio Free Skaro
Magic News Wire
Theory11
Hardcore History
Select shows from How Stuff Works
Sidescrollers
Dude Soup
Select shows from Rooster Teeth


AG's Non-Linux Podcast List

The LPV Show 
The Slanted Lens (Trends from the trenches)
Photofocus
The Ziglar Show

If we forgot anything, perhaps tweet us? Or it is most likely a duck duck away.



Download the episode here. 


Listen and Subscribe... 



we're @thirdworldlinux and @chFourteen on twitter
we're also on Google+
but if you're oldschool, email us
contact@channelfourteen.com 
linux@channelfourteen.com

item.title: Third World Linux - Episode 58: The Perfect Linux Distro Revisited?
item.description:
In the podcast this week...

We revisit our criteria for what we think the perfect linux distro would be for our particular use cases.

In the off tangent (starts at 45:07), we talk about USB and the Ouya. 

 Joao's Criteria:

Customizable
Fast
Sustainable
Good robust repos
Exhaustive installation process
Must look good in its default


AG's Criteria:

Intuitive Graphic User Interface - A good desktop environment
Smooth - A right mix of speed and sexy
A good community 
A brainless install


The most important criterion

It has to be thirdworldable

Download the episode here. 


Listen and Subscribe...



we're @thirdworldlinux and @chFourteen on twitter
we're also on Google+
but if you're oldschool, email us
contact@channelfourteen.com
linux@channelfourteen.com


---
